results.title: Butterflies are...
results.brief_description: Two students observe butterflies in their natural habitats in order to learn more about them. Contrasts the belief that insects can be studied by simple observation with the idea that it is necessary to kill and preserve insects in order to gain scientific knowledge about them. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Butterflies and nettles
results.brief_description: Documentary on the life cycle of the tortoiseshell butterfly: first laying their eggs under the leaves of sting nettles and in2-3 weeks the caterpillars emerge and live off the nettle leaves. Then fully grown caterpillars spin a chrysalis. After 3 weeks the new butterfly emerges, and so the cycle continues.

results.title: Butterflies
results.brief_description: This film studies the life history of the cabbage butterfly and the swallow-tail butterfly, showing their habits and characteristics, and their role in nature: that of aiding cross-fertilization of flowers. The cabbage butterfly’s destructiveness and its control by a natural enemy is shown.

results.title: Buttercup
results.creator_credit: Dimension Films and Robert Leland Brown
results.brief_description: This film presents without commentary an ecological story about a buttercup which floats down a mountain stream and ends up being swallowed in polluted industrial waters. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Butt welds in sheet metal
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Gas Welding”.
Episode five in a series of nine short instructional films showing methods for oxyacetylene welding. This film demonstrates how welding on a sheet of metal and then welding with a rod are necessary steps before proceeding to butt weld two pieces of metal together.

results.title: Butch minds the baby (K)
results.creator_credit: Adrian Hughes, Park Village Productions and Peter Webb
results.brief_description: A humorous film based on a short story by Damon Runyon and told through voice-over narration. This film is set in Manhattan in the summer of 1931 when the unemployment situation drives a bunch of hoodlums to approach famous safe-cracker Big Butch with a plan: if he carries out a job they have arranged, they will split the payoff. Butch foresees just one complication, his wife is away for the evening and he is babysitting John Ignatius Jnr.

results.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Foreman, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and George Roy Hill
results.brief_description: Butch Cassidy (Paul Newman) and the Sundance Kid (Robert Redford) are two of the West’s more audacious Frontier outlaws. Following their various schemes and robberies, “Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid” is both a Western comedy and a ‘buddy’ movie. Redford and Newman play the bandits of the title with charm and style, sparring with one another, whilst cooking up adventurous plans. Joining them in their tomfoolery is Sundance’s girlfriend Etta Place (Katherine Ross), a schoolteacher, with a soft spot for both men. “Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid” is a revisionist Western which toys with the convention of the bandit who outsmarts the law with stealth, in this case accidents of fate being a major factor in Butch and Sundance’s success. The film pitches Butch and Sundance, with their values firmly defined by the code of the Old West, against the ways of a new modern order. William Goldman won an Academy Award for best original screenplay. Original music by Burt Bacharach and costumes by Edith Head.

results.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Foreman, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and George Roy Hill
results.brief_description: Prime western with warmth and great humour about the exploits of one of the last great bands of outlaws since Jesse James. Butch Cassidy and the deadly Sundance Kid are the most likeable outlaws in the West and amongst the most successful until their most ingenious caper, a round-trip train robbery, backfires, putting the west’s most relentless bounty hunters on their trail. Butch and the Kid use all their wiles to avoid capture, and finally elude their posse by making a hair-raising hundred foot jump into a raging mountain stream. Headed for Bolivia, the outlaws continue to rob banks until they meet their destiny. Stars Paul Newman, Robert Redford and Katharine Ross.

results.title: But you're a girl
results.creator_credit: Julie Ruth, Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology and Sue Johnston
results.brief_description: Shows some of the areas girls have traditionally worked in are no longer certain providers of jobs and then goes on to look at other job options such as trades, apprenticeships and traditionally male dominated professions. Indicates that is is possible for girls and young women to enter these areas, do well in them and enjoy them.
